resources.string: Points of interest on this trip:

The left panel shows the trips of Oxford that you can choose from.
 Use the dropdown menu on the top bar to change how the trips are sorted. This can be done in 3 ways:
 - by filename (default)
 - alphabetically
 - by proximity to the start of the trip (needs a GPS signal)
 Touch a trip to see its details in the right panel.
 If you cannot see the complete list of locations on the trip, touch the list and scroll.
 When you decide which trip you want, click the blue Start trip button!

You are now in a trip. Hold up your device as you go about the city of Oxford, and follow the directions to the next point of interest.
 POINTS OF INTEREST:
 The name and distance of the next location are on the bottom of the screen. Use the Previous or Next buttons to skip points.
 When you reach the next point of interest, the app will display information about it in a box, including recent tweets.
 A green marker may be visible on your screen when you reach the point.
 Tap the marker once to view tweets, and twice to load the next POI. To return to the trip selection screen, press your device's Back button.
 MAP:
 Click Show Map to display a map of the trip (needs internet). You can then display and animate the route to the next point.
 Blue markers are visited points, green is the next point on the trip, purple are later points on the trip.
 R will display the route to the next POI (if possible), and A will animate this.
 To return to the camera view from the map, press your device's Back button.

 Maps behaviour implemented using Google Maps API.
 Twitter feed implemented using Twitter4j.
